result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Throw/Discharge Bodily Fluid at Public Safety Worker or Prosecutor
Battery or Threat to Judge, Prosecutor, or Law Enforcement Officer

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Douglas Scott Dobberfuhl

defendant.name: Dobberfuhl, Douglas Scott

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Douglas Scott Dobberfuhl in court.  Attorney Kerri Terann Cleghorn appeared by video for Douglas Scott Dobberfuhl.  Attorney James C Griffin in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for a status conference.  Defense requests final pre-trial and jury trial dates.  Court scheduled the matter as requested.  Case adjourned to Branch 2, Rm 635 CH.
Final pre-trial scheduled for November 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Jury trial scheduled for January 23, 2023 at 09:00 am.

CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD PER JUDGE. 

Case in court for a calendar call.  Defendant Douglas Scott Dobberfuhl in court.  Attorney Kerri Terann Cleghorn is in trial on another matter.  Court scheduled a status conference.  Court advised the defendant to appear in person at the next court date.  Case adjourned to Branch 2, Rm 635 CH.
Status conference scheduled for September 23, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Douglas Scott Dobberfuhl not in court.  Attorney Kerri Terann Cleghorn appeared by video for Douglas Scott Dobberfuhl.  Prosecuting attorney Gerald Henry Alder in court for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for status conference.  No appearance by the defendant.  Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed until the next court date.  Case adjourned to Br. 2.
Calendar call scheduled for September 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Douglas Scott Dobberfuhl in court.  Amanda Korin Kirklewski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Case scheduled for status of counsel. SPD has not yet appointed counsel. Case adjourned, Branch 2 via Zoom.  Status conference scheduled for September 15, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
all conditions remain as previously set.

Defendant Douglas Scott Dobberfuhl in court with Attorney Jade K Hall; both appear by video.  Gregg Herman appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.
Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 02.
Scheduling conference scheduled for August 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Signature bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 1000.00.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Defendant Douglas Scott Dobberfuhl not in court.  Edward OBrien appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. The defendant having failed to appear, the court ordered a bench warrant to issue, any bond forfeited and Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification by the Clerk of Circuit Court.
The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with JR.

Defendant Douglas Scott Dobberfuhl in court.  Kenneth Olstinski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Childs, Branch 2.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 6/17/22 @ 2p
